Crosswalking The Authorities

Carl Boettiger

2018-12-11

Source: vignettes/articles/crosswalk.Rmd
crosswalk.Rmd
library(taxald)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)

Work in progress – the mismatches of itis, col and wd here illustrate the complexity of name matching. Some names resolve multiple times. Some authorities (ITIS) recognize certain synonyms that they still haven’t mapped to accepted id.

fish <- taxa_tbl("fb") %>%  
  select(fb = id, species) %>% 
  collect() 
species <- pull(fish, species)

itis <- ids(species, "itis")
wd <- ids(species, "wd")
col <- ids(species, "col")

## Note each of these authorities all return more rows than we had in the input table!
sapply(list(fb = fish, itis = itis, wd = wd, col = col), function(x) length(x[[1]]))
#>    fb  itis    wd   col 
#> 33124 33153 33127 36351
my_taxa <- fish %>%

  mutate(#itis = get_ids(species, "itis"),
         ncbi = get_ids(species, "ncbi"),
         #col = get_ids(species, "col"),
         gbif = get_ids(species, "gbif"),
         #wd = get_ids(species, "wd"),
         tpl = get_ids(species, "tpl"),
        # fb = get_ids(species, "fb"),
         slb = get_ids(species, "slb")) 
my_taxa %>% 
  select(-species) %>% 
  purrr::map_dbl(function(x) sum(!is.na(x)))
#>    fb  ncbi  gbif   tpl   slb 
#> 33124   287 17378     3     0

Looks like three plants have matching scientific names to some of our fish:

dup <- fish %>% pull(species) %>% ids(authority = "tpl") %>% filter(!is.na(id))
dup
#> # A tibble: 3 x 3
#>   id         name                  rank   
#>   <chr>      <chr>                 <chr>  
#> 1 TPL:57374  Centropogon australis species
#> 2 TPL:236238 Orestias elegans      species
#> 3 TPL:300628 Rondeletia bicolor    species

This also probably explains why col and wd are returning the wrong-length matches:

species <- pull(fish, species)

col_fb <- ids(species, "col") 
dim(col_fb)[1] - length(species)
#> [1] 3227

wd_fb <- ids(species, "wd") 
dim(wd_fb)[1] - length(species)
#> [1] 3

#col_hierarchy <- classification(id = col_fb$id) %>% filter(kingdom == "Animalia") 

taxa_tbl("col", "hierarchy") %>%
  filter(kingdom == "Animalia") %>%
  semi_join(select(col_fb, id), copy = TRUE) %>%
  select(id, species) %>% 
  collect()
#> Joining, by = "id"
#> # A tibble: 32,923 x 2
#>    id           species     
#>    <chr>        <chr>       
#>  1 COL:21092068 immaculata  
#>  2 COL:21092241 felis       
#>  3 COL:21092375 bentincki   
#>  4 COL:21092504 rubrofuscus 
#>  5 COL:21092598 acuminatus  
#>  6 COL:21092599 sadina      
#>  7 COL:21092690 grandicassis
#>  8 COL:21092694 ansorgii    
#>  9 COL:21092789 lineolata   
#> 10 COL:21093101 melanotheron
#> # ... with 32,913 more rows
has_match <- my_taxa %>% 
  select(-species, -fb) %>%
  purrr::map_dfc(function(x) !is.na(x)) %>% 
  rowSums() > 0

my_taxa %>% filter(!has_match)
#> # A tibble: 15,746 x 6
#>    fb       species                     ncbi  gbif  tpl   slb  
#>    <chr>    <chr>                       <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr>
#>  1 FB:46263 Melanochromis lepidiadaptes <NA>  <NA>  <NA>  <NA> 
#>  2 FB:46264 Aspidoras poecilus          <NA>  <NA>  <NA>  <NA> 
#>  3 FB:46265 Aspidoras raimundi          <NA>  <NA>  <NA>  <NA> 
#>  4 FB:46266 Aspidoras rochai            <NA>  <NA>  <NA>  <NA> 
#>  5 FB:46267 Aspidoras spilotus          <NA>  <NA>  <NA>  <NA>

#>  7 FB:46271 Chilodus fritillus          <NA>  <NA>  <NA>  <NA>

#>  9 FB:46274 Rasbora laticlavia          <NA>  <NA>  <NA>  <NA>
